remixlab.remixcam.core
Class InteractiveAvatarFrame

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.remixcam.core.GLFrame
      remixlab.remixcam.core.InteractiveFrame
          remixlab.remixcam.core.InteractiveDrivableFrame
              remixlab.remixcam.core.InteractiveAvatarFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, MouseGrabbable, Trackable
public class InteractiveAvatarFrame
extends InteractiveDrivableFrame
implements Trackable

The InteractiveAvatarFrame class represents an InteractiveDrivableFrame that can be tracked by a Camera, i.e., it implements the Trackable interface.

The cameraPosition() of the camera that is to be tracking the frame (see the documentation of the Trackable interface) is defined in spherical coordinates (azimuth(), inclination() and trackingDistance()) respect to the GLFrame.position() (which defines its target()) of the InteractiveAvatarFrame.

cameraPosition

public Vector3D cameraPosition()
Overloading of Trackable.cameraPosition(). Returns the world coordinates of the camera position computed in computeCameraPosition().

Specified by:
target in interface Trackable
Returns:
Vector3D holding the camera look-at vector defined in the world coordinate system.

computeCameraPosition

public void computeCameraPosition()
Overloading of Trackable.computeCameraPosition().

The cameraPosition() of the camera that is to be tracking the frame (see the documentation of the Trackable interface) is defined in spherical coordinates by means of the azimuth(), the inclination() and trackingDistance()) respect to the GLFrame.position().

Specified by:
computeCameraPosition in interface Trackable
